name: BMO Standard Model Documentation
description: Standard template for comprehensive model documentation at BMO, designed for regulatory scrutiny, audit, and senior stakeholder review.

prompts.hierarchical_summary_prompt_text:
You are the BMO AI Documentation Assistant for Models and Code. Your task is to synthesize a comprehensive, model-centric hierarchical summary from the individual file analyses provided. This summary must be suitable for inclusion in formal model documentation for BMO, targeting audiences including model validators, regulators, and senior management.

INDIVIDUAL FILE ANALYSIS SUMMARIES:
{file_summaries}

**Hierarchical Model Documentation Requirements:**

Construct a hierarchical summary that covers: model purpose/design philosophy; key functional blocks; data and control flow; inter-module dependencies; architectural patterns; and synthesized assumptions/limitations. Use clear, formal language with logical headings.

HIERARCHICAL SUMMARY:

sections.title: Executive Summary
sections.description: A high-level overview of the model, its purpose, key methodologies, primary results (e.g., PFE outcomes if applicable), overall model soundness, and any significant limitations or recommendations. Should be understandable by a non-technical senior audience.

sections.title: 1. Introduction
sections.description: Background, purpose, and scope of the model.

subsections.title: 1.1. Purpose of the Model
subsections.description: Clearly state the business problem the model addresses and its objectives (e.g., PFE calculation for specific trade types, regulatory capital calculation).

subsections.title: 1.2. Scope and Applicability
subsections.description: Define the products, portfolios, or processes the model applies to. Specify any known exclusions or boundaries.

subsections.title: 1.3. Intended Users
subsections.description: Identify the primary users of the model and its outputs.

subsections.title: 1.4. Regulatory Context
subsections.description: Mention any specific regulatory requirements or guidelines the model and its documentation adhere to (e.g., SR 11-7, OSFI E-23).

sections.title: 2. Model Methodology
sections.description: Detailed explanation of the theoretical basis, mathematical formulation, assumptions, and limitations of the chosen methodology.

subsections.title: 2.1. Theoretical Basis
subsections.description: Describe the financial or mathematical theories underpinning the model (e.g., Geometric Brownian Motion, Black-Scholes, Monte Carlo simulation principles).

subsections.title: 2.2. Mathematical Formulation
subsections.description: Present key equations, algorithms, and logical steps involved in the model's calculations. Define all variables and parameters.

subsections.title: 2.3. Assumptions and Justifications
subsections.description: List all significant assumptions made in the model design (mathematical, data-related, or implementation-specific). Provide justifications for each assumption and discuss their potential impact.

subsections.title: 2.4. Limitations of the Methodology
subsections.description: Discuss inherent limitations of the chosen theories, mathematical approaches, or algorithms.

sections.title: 3. Data
sections.description: Comprehensive description of data used by the model, including sources, specifications, transformations, and quality assessment.

subsections.title: 3.1. Input Data Sources and Specifications
subsections.description: Detail all input data elements, their sources (e.g., specific upstream systems, vendor feeds, internal databases), frequency, and format. Reference specific configuration files (e.g., trades.json, market_data.json).

subsections.title: 3.2. Data Preprocessing and Transformations
subsections.description: Describe any cleaning, filtering, transformation, or imputation steps applied to the raw data before it is used by the model.

subsections.title: 3.3. Data Quality Assessment
subsections.description: Explain processes for assessing data accuracy, completeness, and appropriateness. Detail how missing, erroneous, or anomalous data are handled.

subsections.title: 3.4. Data Lineage
subsections.description: Conceptually describe the flow of data from its source to its use in the model, and ultimately to the model outputs.

sections.title: 4. Model Implementation
sections.description: Details of how the model methodology is implemented in the production environment.

subsections.title: 4.1. System Architecture
subsections.description: High-level overview of the system components, modules (e.g., data_management, simulation_engine, pfe_calculation), and their interactions. A conceptual diagram or description.

subsections.title: 4.2. Detailed Module Descriptions
subsections.description: For each significant code module or script: state its purpose, key functions/classes, core algorithms, inputs, outputs, and dependencies. This section should heavily reference the automated file summaries.

subsections.title: 4.3. Key Parameters and Calibration
subsections.description: Identify key model parameters, distinguish between calibrated parameters and fixed inputs. Describe calibration methods if applicable. Reference specific configuration files (e.g., simulation_params.json).

subsections.title: 4.4. Code Version Control
subsections.description: Briefly describe the version control system and practices used for the model codebase (e.g., Git, branching strategy).

subsections.title: 4.5. Computational Aspects
subsections.description: Specify the programming languages, key libraries/packages (conceptual, not specific versions), and any significant computational resources or dependencies.

sections.title: 5. Model Validation
sections.description: Overview of the model validation process, activities, and findings. (This section outlines what would be documented; the AI generates a conceptual structure based on common practices).

subsections.title: 5.1. Validation Framework Overview
subsections.description: Describe the governance and process for independent model validation.

subsections.title: 5.2. Backtesting
subsections.description: Describe the methodology and results of any backtesting performed.

subsections.title: 5.3. Benchmarking
subsections.description: Comparison against alternative models or industry benchmarks.

subsections.title: 5.4. Sensitivity and Stress Testing
subsections.description: Analysis of model behavior under various input and parameter changes, and extreme conditions.

subsections.title: 5.5. Key Validation Findings and Recommendations
subsections.description: Summary of material findings from the validation process and any resulting recommendations or model adjustments.

sections.title: 6. Reporting and Output
sections.description: Description of the model's outputs and how they are reported and interpreted.

subsections.title: 6.1. Description of Output Files/Reports
subsections.description: Detail the format and content of key model outputs (e.g., PFE profiles, risk metrics). Reference output files if applicable.

subsections.title: 6.2. Interpretation of Results
subsections.description: Guidance on how to interpret the model outputs and their implications.

sections.title: 7. Model Governance and Controls
sections.description: Information related to the governance, monitoring, and control of the model.

subsections.title: 7.1. Model Ownership
subsections.description: Identify the business unit and individuals responsible for the model.

subsections.title: 7.2. Ongoing Monitoring
subsections.description: Describe procedures for ongoing monitoring of model performance and stability.

subsections.title: 7.3. Change Management Process
subsections.description: Outline the process for requesting, approving, implementing, and documenting changes to the model.

subsections.title: 7.4. Access Controls
subsections.description: Describe controls over access to model code, data, and systems.

sections.title: 8. Overall Model Limitations and Weaknesses
sections.description: A consolidated summary of the model's key limitations and weaknesses, drawing from methodological, data, and implementation aspects. Discuss potential impacts and mitigating factors if any.

sections.title: 9. Conclusion and Recommendations
sections.description: Overall assessment of the model's fitness for purpose, and any recommendations for future development, enhancements, or usage.

sections.title: Appendix A: Glossary of Terms
sections.description: Definitions of key technical terms, acronyms, and business-specific jargon used in the document.

sections.title: Appendix B: Code File Manifest
sections.description: A list of all key code files in the model, their paths, and a brief description of their purpose (can be auto-generated from file summaries).
